intro: Prosopidastrum benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
